description: Humanity has always struggled to reach the stars, but if you weather the tribulations of flames and explosions, there will always be a way.

name: 8:31P.M.
description: Diplomacy through violence - this has always been ironclad law used to communicate among those who have come to believe it.

name: Evening Breeze's Kiss
description: There are always people who think, 'Ah, everything is going according to plan.' Coincidentally, everyone seems to think that tonight.

name: 10:26P.M.
description:
Things that are truly excellent will always shine forth, even if stripped of the other trappings normally around it - for example, the discerning gentleman's armament of choice - an empty wine bottle. 
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></>Grants additional skill points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: 11:08P.M.
description:
Brothers turn against one another, old friends reunite, nobody can tell friend from foe, and everyone's happy that way. 
<@lv.rem><Command Terminal></> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when destroyed.

name: 11:41P.M.
description:
Some people's bad habits stink up the entire office. Others stink up the entire city. 
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></>Grants additional skill points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: Midnight in Lungmen
description: Rumor has it that at midnight, you can encounter ghosts on the streets of Lungmen who will usher you to a glorious, bygone era. However, you have to take some time to discern whether these 'ghosts' are actually living or dead.

name: 0:01A.M.
description:
The great thing about outdoor parties is that there's plenty of room to crack some skulls. The bad thing is, you'll probably end up disturbing the peace. Most of the time, the pros and cons cancel reinforce each other. 
<@lv.rem><Command Terminal></> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when destroyed.
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></> Grants additional Skill Points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: 1:11A.M.
description: When a farce is mixed with alcohol and brought to a boil, perhaps the only ones who will remember what happened are those who watched from the outside.

name: Crack of Dawn
description: Those lurking behind the curtains always have much to gossip about, perhaps to make the next show a bit more exciting, or perhaps just to cross each others' palms.

name: Gang Fight Tactics
description: It's best not to piss off too many people at the same time. If you end up in an all-out brawl, it's better to keep things as a series of one-on-ones.

name: Gang Fight Tactics
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemy Marksmen have significantly increased ATK.

name: Unintended Consequences
description:
Go right? Go left! 
<@lv.item><Roadblock></>Deploy to block the enemy's route.

name: Unintended Consequences
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemy melee units have significantly increased ATK.

name: Cabin in the Woods
description:
Every so often, one encounters a piece of postmodern architectural art while wandering through the slums or some other random place, perhaps a symbol of rapture in the concrete jungle.
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></>Grants additional skill points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: Cabin in the Woods
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Maximum squad size is reduced to 5 Operators.

name: Construction Site
description:
Who installed a terminal here? 
<@lv.rem><Command Terminal></> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when destroyed.
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></> Grants additional Skill Points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: Construction Site
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemy Elite Marksmen have double HP and increased attack range.

name: Crossroads
description:
Crossing the road isn't hard, unless you insist on doing it diagonally.  
<@lv.rem><Command Terminal></> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when destroyed.
<@lv.item><Roadblock></> Deploy to block the enemy's route.

name: Crossroads
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The DP Cost of Caster Operators is tripled.

name: All-Out Charge
description: That fella seems to be a pretty scrappy fighter, but why can't they walk in a straight line?

name: All-Out Charge
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Guard and Vanguard Operators have -1 Block.

name: Morning Exercise
description:
If you take a lap or two around the park in the morning, you might meet an old man strolling about. 
<@lv.rem><Portable Supply Station></>Grants additional skill points to a character or to the Command Terminal.

name: Morning Exercise
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
6 tiles on the battlefield are no longer available for deployment.

name: Everyday Life
description:
Drunkards, thugs, and vagrants with swollen noses and blue faces sit side by side in an abandoned parking lot, singing. 
<@lv.rem><Command Terminal></> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when destroyed.
<@lv.rem><Roadblock></> Deploy to block the enemy's route.

name: Everyday Life
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The maximum cost of Control Terminal skill is increased by 50%.

name: Rock On
description:
It took one whole week on the road to get here. 
For some, of course, the journey itself is part of the vacation.

name: Made of Lava
description:
A sizzling summer with thrilling music - could this festival get any better? 
However, perfection tends to be short-lived, as a massive crisis approaches without warning.
<@lv.rem>Unable to deploy some Operators on the field</>

name: Break Free
description: When paralyzed by a lack of information and preparation, it is recklessness, rather than caution, that has the ability to break the impasse.

name: To be Continued
description: The show must stop, but there are those who disagree.

name: Race Walking
description: With just a single phone call, you can get all the help you need - even when you are on the run. How reassuring.

name: The General
description: It is rare to find someone in an ordinary city who can match the power of General Hellagur. An unexpected development.

name: Under the Gun
description:
When the one you trust most has betrayed you, are you willing to believe that she has her own reasons? 
Or are there no justifications for betrayal?

name: Don't Stop Me Now
description: True courage comes from facing and accepting the truth.

name: Killer Queen
description:
The true villains always appear at the worse possible moment.
Naturally, that's the best possible time for moment for them. 
<@lv.rem>Unable to deploy some Operators on the field</>

name: In the Name of Love
description: Whether true love means watching silently or speaking frankly, there is no clear answer.

name: Final Stroke
description: A brightest firework in the grandest ceremony is a thrilling idea, if only the villains don't think so.

name: Siesta Rhapsody
description:
A giant creature assumes the role of the last boss, by no fault of its own. Sometimes, that's a more satisfying conclusion than some desperate villain. 
<@lv.item><Lava Fountains></> spray out lava periodically, dealing massive damage to friendly units on the surrounding 8 tiles and melting down Roadblocks.

name: Love of this Life
description: The many stories passed down over time may seem simplistic, but they may well be equal parts heartwarming and heartwrenching.

name: Waterslide
description: The water's fine, but don't forget to stretch first.

name: Drifting, Falling
description: Beware of the true dangers that conceal themselves among the crowds.

name: Carousel
description: Hold this position! Why are we holding this position? How should I know?

name: Volcano Climb
description:
Originium Slugs are supposed to be slow and clumsy creatures that are easy to deal with. 
But what about a moving volcano? 
<@lv.item><Lava Fountains></> spray out lava periodically, dealing massive damage to friendly units on the surrounding 8 tiles and melting down Roadblocks.

name: Warming-up
description: This may well be your last chance to put on a song and relax. Seize the opportunity before it slips away from you.

name: Warming-up
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemy ranged units have significantly increase range.

name: Grand Opening
description: It may not be as hot as you think... as long as you stop venturing deeper.

name: Grand Opening
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemies have significantly higher DEF.

name: Interview Time
description: Imagine you've got a superstar right behind you, and your job is to keep him from the fervent mob of fans.

name: Interview Time
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Enemies have significantly higher ASPD.

name: Getting Better
description: It is known that some passionate fans would do whatever it takes to get closer to their idol.

name: Getting Better
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Medic Operators cost three times as much to deploy.

name: The Climax
description:
Most of our Operators are strong enough to handle a little lava, but you'd better cover their new outfits. 
<@lv.item><Lava Fountains></> spray out lava periodically, dealing massive damage to friendly units on the surrounding 8 tiles and melting down Roadblocks

name: The Climax
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Deployment Points regenerate 66% slower.

name: Perfect Ending
description:
Try chucking a rock into the lava and see what happen. The results might not please you. 
<@lv.item><Roadblock></> Deploy it to block the enemy's route
<@lv.item><Lava Fountains></> spray out lava periodically, dealing massive damage to friendly units on the surrounding 8 tiles and melting down Roadblocks

name: Perfect Ending
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Number of available Roadblocks is reduced by 50%.

name: Ignition
description:
Striking at precisely the right time is crucial to success in battle. And being able to recognize that timing is the difference between an effective commander and a footnote failure. 
<@lv.item><Stun Generator></> Pay a cost to activate it, damaging and stunning nearby enemies.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Ignition
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The Speed of enemy units is increased significantly.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Gathering
description:
Just need a little push...
<@lv.item><Medical Rune></> Operators deployed on it are healed over time.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Gathering
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
Operator deployment limit is reduced by 2.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Speckles
description:
When you exploit the terrain to your advantage, the enemy will seek to do the same. Be well aware, strategy is an art of action and reaction.
<@lv.item><Detector></> Once activated, it will reveal nearby invisible enemies for a period of time.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Speckles
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The range of the enemy's ranged units is increased significantly.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Sleight of Hand
description:
If we could just lay out some bait...
<@lv.item><Heated Path></>Deals massive damage to Operators and enemies on it at intervals.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Sleight of Hand
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The range of enemy abilities is greatly increased.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Prolonged Destruction
description:
Hinder the enemy's movements, delay the clash of forces, slow the pace of deployment, and realign the entire war.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: Prolonged Destruction
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The recovery speed of Deployment Points is reduced by 33%.
<@act.timeLimit>Stage open from: 3/25 10:00 - 4/8 03:59</>

name: High Noon
description:
Sand is blowing wildly outside Kazimierz. Down from the abandoned gallows there is a greedy, cunning rioter, while behind him stands a knight who has just crossed the desert alone with nothing but the lance in her hand.
<@lv.rem>Some Operators cannot be deployed</>

name: Sophistication
description: People gather in the bar for all sorts of different reasons. They each have their own axe to grind, but after weighing the pros and cons, decide to work together over a few rounds of beer. However, before they can even take two steps out the door, the temporary truce falls apart violently. Such is the life of bounty hunters.

name: An Unexpected Journey
description:
Nobody is going to give up the treasure without a fight, and the troublemakers just keep coming one after another. Obviously, most of them have no idea what a 'fair fight' means.
<@lv.rem>Some Operators cannot be deployed</>

name: Turn State's Evidence
description:
Even more reliable than death and taxes is the unpredictability of life. It even works on your friends, your enemies, and even your own beliefs.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

name: Different Opinions
description:
It's said that no great fortune comes without sin, because the path to wealth is always paved with violence and bloodshed.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

name: Golden Triangle
description:
Everyone has their own path. You choose your path, while she chooses hers. Some roads may be more dangerous than others, but we all reach the same destination in the end.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

name: True Grit
description: These little critters that have crawled up from underground are extremely dangerous. Their homes have been destroyed as a result of the bounty hunters' rampant excavation, so all they know how to do now is to return the favor.

name: No Country for Old Men
description: The terrain is simple but the fighting is gritty. Useless traps and coins are scattered everywhere.

name: Dances with Wolves
description: 'Beware of wolf packs'

name: The Treasure of the Kazimierz Mortica
description:
It's annoying to dig for treasure underground, because you can never tell whether it's dirt or an Originium Slug that falls into your hair.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

name: The Treasure of the Kazimierz Mortica
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The deployment cost of ranged Operators is tripled.

name: Stagecoach
description:
To seize victory, one must carve a bloody path through the defenses of their enemies. Our poor enemies.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

name: Stagecoach
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The Attack Speed of all enemies is increased significantly.

name: Once Upon a Time in the West
description:
Heavily armed enemies are constantly pouring in from all directions. It's not their fault — you blocked the only way out, after all.
<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.
<@lv.item><Roadblock></> Deploy to block the enemy's route

name: Once Upon a Time in the West
description:
<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
The cost of Roadblocks is tripled.

name: Chernobog
description:
Annihilate the large number of Reunion mobs in Chernobog. Watch out for the leaders patrolling the area.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Lungmen Outskirts
description:
Annihilate the dangerous Reunion mobs lurking in the outskirts of Lungmen, and ensure that no threat is posed to the safety of the city.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Lungmen Downtown
description:
Annihilate the Reunion armed forces that have invaded Lungmen, and regain initiative within the region.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: The Grand Knight Territory Outskirts
description:
A large-scale competitive exhibition game organized by the Kazimierz General Chamber of Commerce. As a defender, Rhodes Island must make use of sponsor drones to deal with the Knightclubs' elites.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Frozen Abandoned City
description:
Well-organized Reunion guerrillas are hiding in this abandoned nomadic city in the tundra of Ursus. Be prepared for the deathly chill, as that is your only hope for victory.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Abandoned Mine
description:
A remote mine in Ursus where the Infected Patrol Unit are hunting down the Infected. Make good use of the tricky terrain to buy time for the Infected to escape.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally and failing to save an Ursus civilian will result in a penalty of -1 annihilation count.

name: Flooded Seashore
description:
An unassuming beach on the coastline of Siesta currently overrun by Sicilians and rioters. Utilize the Command Terminals provided by the city of Siesta and apprehend them posthaste.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Watery Tidehollow
description:
As the tides surge, the Seaborn grow restless deep within a vast cavern. With the help of the remaining Iberian machines there, eliminate the Seaborn threat once and for all.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally

name: Long Spring Wastes
description:
After the 'Watchtower 33' incident, some 'Redmark' mercenaries avoided Rhodes Island's pursuit while controlling the remnant Originiutant mutants. If these organisms are allowed to escape to other areas, the outcome would be disastrous. Please carry out a thorough extermination.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally
<@lv.item><Sandstorm></> Allied units caught inside the sandstorm will have reduced ATK, continuously take damage over time, and have extended redeployment time; Enemy units will instead be slowed

name: Dossoles Water Gate
description:
Lady Candela recently invested in two Leithanian 'Gramophones.' She hopes that Rhodes Island will participate in a joint exercise with the Dossoles Defense Squad to test out the point-defense capabilities of the 'Gramophones.'
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><'Gramophone'></> Both allied and enemy units will fight for control over this device; When activated, deals Arts damage to enemies and heals allies.

name: South Prison
description:
The convict Jesselton, having been transferred from Mansfield State Prison, has incited a prison riot, aided by the local Siracusan gangs who decided to join in. Rhodes Island must intervene immediately and put down the insurrection using the Imprisonment Devices. 
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></>DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><Imprisonment Device></>Imprisons freed enemies within its effect area.

name: County Hillock Countryside
description:
After accepting a commission from Victoria, Rhodes Island sets out to deal with Spectre Force active in the County Hillock countryside.
<@lv.rem><Condition></> DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><Tattered Pillar> </>Can be knocked down by neighboring Operators, dealing True damage to the two tiles it falls on and forming rubble that blocks routes.

name: Night Champion Show
description:
A corporation in Kazimierz is planning an unusual game show. Participants must fend off wave after wave of knight attacks in order to claim the grand prize. Rhodes Island has been invited as a contestant. 
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></> DP will not regenerate naturally. 
<@lv.item><City Neon></> Provides an initial amount of visibility, and can further increase visibility when used

name: Lingering Shangshu Trails
description:
Wares of all shapes and sizes have once again appeared on the twisting mountain paths. Are they seeking the goblet which once granted them sentience, which was subsequently cast from the mountains? The relevant bureaus in Yan have requested Rhodes Island's assistance in this matter.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></>DP will not regenerate naturally.

name: Chocolate Street
description:
The Summit of Nations is over, and Pathfinders that have not left with the Guide remain in Laterano, trying to restore faith there in their own way. They have caused a disturbance in the commercial area of the Stevonus district, and the Notarial Hall has requested help from Rhodes Island.
<@lv.rem><Special Condition></>DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><'Gelato Stop'></>Both allied and enemy units will fight for control over this device; When activated, restores SP of surrounding allies

name: Penumbra Shipyards
description:
The shipyard that built ships such as the Stultifera Navis has become a nest of Sea Terrors. The Inquisition has contracted Rhodes Island to eliminate them in order to salvage a Golden Age ship-of-the line that is still restorable.
<@lv.rem><Condition></> DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><Hand of the Saint - Purification Mode></> Bounces a 'Hand of the Saint' in the deployed direction, stunning and dealing damage to enemies it collides with, and clearing Nethersea Brand in its path.

name: Research Base Hanger
description:
The prototype power armors stored in Test Site 359's hanger have suddenly reactivated during the cleanup work. The Rhodes Island operators present must quickly intervene and bring this incident to a close.
<@lv.rem><Special Conditions></>DP will not regenerate naturally.
<@lv.item><R-Series Power Armor></>Absorbs nearby experimental products to recover SP. Activates when SP is full.

name: Training Ground #7
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area in a basic manner.

name: Training Ground #9
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's terrain in greater detail.

name: Training Ground #10
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's environment in extraordinary detail.

name: The Swarming Masses
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
For the thugs in the barrens, the important thing isn't who snatches the steak, but who gobbles it down before anyone else can do anything about it.

name: Passing Down the Profit
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
Not a single Siracusan famiglia will sit idly by while someone else monopolizes a lucrative industry. Though the times have changed, their profit-driven hearts have not.

name: Industrial Improvement
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
As the mastermind behind the theft of the under-construction plate, Sandel knows how to keep abreast of the times. However, after purchasing cutting-edge technology and the latest know-how from Kazimierz, his coffers - stretched thin to begin with - have ended up dry.

name: Bad Company
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
It is not as if Ms. Candela had not considered shadier methods before reaching out to Rhodes Island. But in the eyes of the special detachment she sent, her way of greasing palms seemed like pocket change compared to the windfall Sandel promised.

name: Tipsy Trip
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
Afterwards, thanks to Pozëmka's appeals to emotion and Gavial's appeals to reason, the Durins finally agreed to cut down on the amount they drink—at least enough to not randomly follow other people around after one round.

name: A Piece of Steak
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
The grown-up Sandel no longer has to cry in the locker room after losing a fight over some lunch money. Because he's smart enough, brave enough, and mean enough, he still has a way to go.

name: The Swarming Masses
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
For the thugs in the barrens, the important thing isn't who snatches the steak, but who gobbles it down before anyone else can do anything about it.

description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3

description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
Afterwards, thanks to Pozëmka's appeals to emotion and Gavial's appeals to reason, the Durins finally agreed to cut down on the amount they drink—at least enough to not randomly follow other people around after one round.

name: A Piece of Steak
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
The grown-up Sandel no longer has to cry in the locker room after losing a fight over some lunch money. Because he's smart enough, brave enough, and mean enough, he still has a way to go.

name: Jungle Greetings
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
Tiacauhans are no stranger to the fistful method of saying hello, and neither are you.

name: Biodiversity
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
Confronted with a swarm of infected creatures, you notice some rarer species among them—but you don't have time to worry about that, because there are also a bunch of belligerent Tiacauhans in the mix.

name: Adaptation
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
After seeing Acahualla's overblown ecosystem for yourself, you no longer care to express your opinion on the good-for-nothings getting chummy with the infected creatures.

name: Glade
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
You find a clearing in the jungle, clear the Originium slugs from it, and plan to let the team rest up here. However, your actions seem to have gotten in the way of a group of outsiders who had a similar idea.

name: Not Letting Go
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
The outsiders' persistent attacks are getting on your nerves. You decide to crush them first, before dealing with whatever caused the rainforest to flourish out of control.

name: Man And Nature
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
You thought you'd seen everything in Acahualla, but nature's wild side always has a way of leaving you dumbfounded. Facing the extremely aggressive sea of flowers before you, all you can do is pray not to sneeze TOO much.

name: Jungle Greetings
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
Tiacauhans are no stranger to the fistful method of saying hello, and neither are you.

description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3

description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
You thought you'd seen everything in Acahualla, but nature's wild side always has a way of leaving you dumbfounded. Facing the extremely aggressive sea of flowers before you, all you can do is pray not to sneeze TOO much.

name: Mine #5
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
A small group of engineers of unknown origin have hidden themselves in the abandoned mine. Upon discovery by picket officers, both sides fell into conflict, hindering the cleanup of the mine.

name: Mercenary
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
Several infamous mining contractors found themselves chased out of Siesta after multiple violations the Obsidian trading laws. Apparently they haven't learned anything from the debacle though, as they plot to continue their actions elsewhere.

name: Evil Forces
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
The local gangs and scoundrels seem to have their eye on the mine, regularly coming over to 'see what they can help with.' These people are harder to shake off than a hound.

name: Ineffectual Organization
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
The scattered rioters appear strangely used to acting as an organization. They've somehow acquired Reunion uniforms and have begun acting as such. Their by-laws? Nothing but destruction.

name: Sand Beast Cave
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
A group of exiled mercenaries have taken to using the place as a ranch. The sand beasts feed on the mutated Originium slugs, and often race about the mine in excitement after a meal.

name: Equipment Acceptance Testing
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
The mine has just purchased a new batch of vehicles from another city, intending to modify them for mineral transport. The docking process was rather smooth, until people broke into the final acceptance testing site.

name: Secret Base
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
Defender Elites dig to expand the available space, while engineers take apart and reassemble the existing electrical equipment. These rioters disguised as Reunion have unscrupulously taken over the mine and are preparing to convert it into a secret base.

name: Nature's Premature Death
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
An eye opens in the darkness, slag falling from its eyelid like a inky black waterfall. It has always lived in the depths of this mine. Is it a creature nurtured by nature, or a victim of the steady progress of civilization?

name: Good Neighbor
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
During the mine's inactivity, the neighboring forest farm has 'legally' expanded its territory. You approach them to get in touch, but their patrol hounds and security personnel are not particularly welcoming.

name: Groundbreaking Ceremony
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
The groundbreaking ceremony's congratulatory salvo has barely faded when hordes of metal crabs and armed rioters surge in from all directions. They are almost certainly not here to celebrate.

name: Wanderers' Shelter
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
To these Sarkaz mercenaries who lost their home and wandered so far to get here, having their territory seized is a humiliation of the highest order. You are viewed as invaders trespassing on their domain.

name: 'Arena'
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
The local fanatics have dressed up like Kazimierz knights, shirking honest work and instead fighting each other in duels... They've set up an arena in the mine.

name: Leaving Home
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
After leaving their homes in search of better job opportunities, these Tiacauh Warriors and Shieldguards were hired to 'fight evil' at the mine. They've obviously been taken for a ride.

name: Originium Pollution
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
The mine once accidentally unearthed an Originium Slug nest, resulting in serious contamination of the site. Now, the cleanup has once again disturbed those same Infected creatures, as they rush to the surface in a bid to escape to the wilderness.

name: Vicious Competition
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
A large number of mercenaries and wandering Infected have rushed into the mine and are sowing chaos in an organized manner. Upon investigation, it appears they were hired by a competing miners in the same city.

name: Unto the Breach
description:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
A gigantic creature of unknown origin tears through the earth and rocks as gang members and thugs gather around it, rapidly approaching the recently cleaned up mining site together. Is it under the control of these villains, or is it spurring them on?

name: Right of Way
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>0
A group of armed engineers claim that the mining platform is in their way. They demand that it move aside, or allow them to pass through it.

name: Coming Prepared
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>1
Members in heavy equipment draw attention while their allies penetrate the defense line into the mining layer. These people came prepared.

name: Organized Ranks
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>2
There was a misunderstanding between the engineers and the Shieldguard. The warriors who broke away from Reunion have not lost their way: they remain organized and disciplined, defending Ursus in their own way.

name: 'Ursus Tournament'
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>3
The insurgents have obtained the gear of Kazimierz Knightclubs. The rules of the tournament have been simplified: lives equal points. The faint-of-heart are relegated to the spectator stands. The restoration of the mining platform seems to have interrupted their 'tournament.'

name: 'Undisciplined Rabble'
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>4
Bouncers, thugs, vagrants... vagabonds of all sorts come looking for trouble as the cleanup continues. Seems like this is about more than just protection money.

name: Engineering Checkup
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>5
As the mining platform links up with the nomadic city for maintenance, militants disguised as engineers sabotage the platform under the cover of drones.

name: Sudden Visit
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>6
A group claiming to be Ursus military tries to shut down the mining platform, saying that they received a tip-off regarding Reunion remnants in the area. They have not been able to present proper identification, however.

name: Long Journey
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>7
It climbs out slowly, wearing its massive 'hut' on its back and leaving a trail of glowing lights behind, illuminating the dark underground world. There was a plan in place to relocate it, but unexpected interference has complicated things.

name: Serendipity
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>0
Słoma Foods originally touted knight tournaments as one of the perks of working on its platforms, but few knights are willing to fight in such tiny arenas. Ironically, it is now inhabited by those who are down on their luck since the platform's abandonment.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: True or False
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>1
There have been many sightings of Brassrust since his disappearance, but all have turned out to be imitators. This one should be no exception.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Gentle Nights
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>2
The neon lights of the city struggle to illuminate the deeply-rooted darkness. The light of a candle may be able to do so... or maybe not.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Rock and a Hard Place
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>3
Retired competition knights usually fade into obscurity, though there are always some fans who never forget―not necessarily to the benefit of the knights themselves.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Battered Branches
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>4
It is a massive labyrinth within the food processing platform. Even twins may lose sight of each other.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Journey's Rest
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>5
'Civilization' is everywhere in Kazimierz. The more you scorn it, the closer it creeps.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Scattered Dirt
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>6
Goods are chosen, goods are made, goods are thrown away. Neither the production line nor the goods need subjectivity.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

name: Bottomless Pit
description:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>7
Pincers used for fighting have degenerated, while its mouthparts have been twisted into tentacles. The mutations brought on by consuming too much industrial material have made this Gloompincer unrecognizable in both form and behavior, a mouth that is constantly trying to fill its insatiable stomach.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.
